snippet: Organizations across the political spectrum say new regulations drafted to curb a surge in political spending and activity by nonprofits are far too broad.
abstract: Both progressive and conservative advocacy groups are raising objections to new Internal Revenue Service rules proposed by Obama administration to rein in political activity by nonprofit organizations that are not required to disclose sources of their funding.
lead_paragraph: Organizations across the political spectrum say new regulations drafted to curb a surge in political spending and activity by nonprofits are far too broad.

headline.main: Left and Right Object to I.R.S. Plan to Restrict Nonprofits’ Political Activity
headline.print_headline: Left and Right Object to I.R.S. Plan to Restrict Nonprofits’ Political Activity
